Following are the FAQs I can help you with: 

     ||What is Approval Process?||
||Main Category||     ||Approval Process Sub Category||

As defined in the AICTE act 1987, 
Technical Education means programs, of Education, Research, and training in 
 Engineering and Technology, Architecture, Town Planning, Management,
Pharmacy,and Applied Arts and Crafts,and such other programs or areas as 
the CentralGovernment may in consultation with the Council,
by notification in the official gazette declare.

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General
Main Category

As per this Scheme, Senior academicians (serving or superannuated)
shall be nominated as Margdarshak(MD) to act as individual mentors for guiding beneficiary institutes
to achieve the NBA accreditation and enhance the quality of technical education.
Council is making payment of Traveling Allowance (as per actual)
and Honorarium of Rs.5000/- per day to these Margdarshaks.

General

Following are the FAQs I can help you with:

type the number for following FAQ's answer
1)Is NBA accreditation mandatory for institutions to become MI?
2)Which can be the Mentee Beneficiary Institutes (MBIs)?
3)What are the guidelines for selection of MBIs?
4)What is the procedure for change MBI?

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General.
Main Category

Que:-1)Is NBA accreditation mandatory for institutions to become MI?

Yes, an institute making an application for MI must have accredited programmes
which should be valid for at least six months from the date of submission of the proposal.
(Refer to Chapter 2, Para 3(b) to (d) of the guidelines).

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General.
Main Category

Que:-2)Which can be the Mentee Beneficiary Institutes (MBIs)?

Only AICTE approved institutes having potential to go for NBA accreditation and willing to get mentorship under Margdarshan scheme are called Mentee Beneficiary Institutes (MBIs).
Maximum of 10 such MBIs can be mapped with an MI for mentoring

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General.
Main Category

Que:-3)What are the guidelines for selection of MBIs?

Kindly refer to Chapter 2, para 5 of the Margdarshan Initiative document.
Only AICTE approved institutes are eligible to receive mentoring from Mls. For the sake of convenience,
the MIs are expected to choose MBIs which are in their vicinity with a maximum distance of 200 km.
MIs have to submit present status of the department-wise Pre-Qualifier (as per NBA format) of all the proposed MBIs.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General
Main Category

Que:-4)What is the procedure for change MBI?

No change in MBIs (addition, deletion or change)
what-so-ever shall be permitted (including voluntary withdrawal by MBI itself) as the same shall lead to dilution of objective.
Hence Mls must exercise due diligence in making the DPR / selection of beneficiary institutes
looking forward for accreditation from NBA.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General
Main Category

Following are the FAQs I can help you with:

type the letters for following FAQ's answer:-

e)What is the objective of Margdarshan Initiative?
f)Who can apply to be a mentor institute in Margdarshan scheme?
g)How is Margdarshan implemented?,.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General
Main Category

Margdarshan initiative has been introduced with a broad objective to improve the quality of technical education in the country.
The outcome of the initiative shall be to reform activities
in the AICTE approved institutes such that the quality and equity of technical education improves in a reasonable time-frame.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General
Main Category

A well-established AICTE approved institute shall be nominated as Margdarshan Institute or Mentor Institute (MI) by AICTE
for its continued excellence in imparting technical education in the Country.
The institutions fulfilling the undermentioned requirements are eligible to submit the proposals:-

 The institution, i.e. university, institute, college, etc.
should have been approved by AICTE.
The institution should be in existence for 15 years or more.
There should not have been any penal / administrative action from AICTE / other regulatory bodies during the last l5 years of its existence.
Institution having break in Extension of Approval or no admission in the institution for any reason whatsoever in the last 15 years shall not be considered.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

 About Margdarshan 
MI/MBI 
MD/MDBI 
General
Main Category

This is implemented via two channels, viz Mentor Institutes and Margdarshaks.
Part 1: Margdarshan Institute A well-established AICTE approved institute referred to as Margdarshan Institute or Mentor Institute (MI)
is supported with an objective to mentor up to 10 nearby institutes in achieving the NBA accreditation.
Details are covered in Chapter  Part 2: Margdarshaks Senior academicians (serving or superannuated) shall be nominated as Margdarshak (MD)
to act as individual mentors for guiding beneficiary institutes to achieve the NBA accreditation and enhance the quality of technical education.

About PG Scholarship
Guidelines
Financial
PG General

Scholarship is awarded to full time GATE/GPAT qualified students admitted to M.E./ M. Tech/ M. Arch and M.Pharma courses
in AICTE approved Institutions/Colleges @Rs. 12,400/- PM/ student.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guid Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Following are the FAQs I can help you with:

type the letters for following FAQ's answer:-

h)What are the objective and rate of scholarship under the scheme?
i)What is the duration of PG scholarship period?
j)What are the eligibility condition for availing PG scholarship under the scheme?
k)Is there any reservation for EWS?

Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guid Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-h)What are the objective and rate of scholarship under the scheme?
AICTE in order to ensure development of technical education in India awards Post Graduate Scholarship of Rs. 12,400/- per month
to full-time GATE/GPAT/CEED qualified students admitted to AICTE approved
post graduate programs in AICTE approved Institutions/ University Departments as per AICTE approved intake.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guid Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-i)What is the duration of PG scholarship period?
The Scholarship is tenable for 24 months or for the duration of the course
i.e. from the date of commencement of classes till the date of completion of the classes whichever is lower and is not extendable under any circumstance
Students of final years of dual degree integrated programmes would also be entitled to PG Scholarship
from the 9th semester onwards in case they get a CGPA score of 8 or above (on a scale of 10 )
i.e. only for one year in final year.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guid Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-j)What are the eligibility condition for availing PG scholarship under the scheme?
Post Graduate Scholarship is entitled only to those students:  Having a valid GATE/ GPAT/CEED score at the time of admissio
Must be admitted as a full-time scholar
Students of final years of dual degree integrated programmes would also be entitled to PG Scholarship from the 9th semester onwards
in case they get a CGPA score of 8 or above (on a scale of 10 ) i.e. only for one year in final year
Admitted in AICTE approved Institutions / University Departments & AICTE approved programs
viz. Master of Engineering, Master of Technology, Master of Architecture, Master of Pharmacy and Master of Design.
Number of PG Scholarship is limited to the AICTE approved intake in the programme in that year.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guid Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-k)Is there any reservation for EWS?
In addition to the approved intake, AICTE will provide PG scholarship to the additional 10% candidates
over and above the approved intake of that course from EWS category,
if the university/ institute has admitted students from Economically Weaker Sections (EWSs) as per MHRD OM F.No.12-4/2019-U1 dated 17th January 2019.

Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guid Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-l)Is there any condition for payment of PG scholarship?
The Scholarship will be granted to the student on a monthly basis subject
to the satisfactory academic performance and adherence to University/Institute norms/rules and regulations
as applicable time to time, certified by the Head of the Institute and obligatory work as prescribed.Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guide Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-m)Is there any condition for payment of PG scholarship?
The amount of PG Scholarship is subject to change
as per the notification issued by Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD), New Delhi (now Ministry of Education) from time to time,
with the approval of the Executive Committee of the Council.Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guide Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-n)Is there any salary grant, contingencies etc?
Salary grant or any other grant e.g. Contingencies, Library, Books etc, will not be admissible
to the Institute/College/ University implementing this scheme in compliance with
the instructions of Govt. of India, Ministry of Human Resource Development, Deptt. of Higher Education, Technical Section - I
conveyed vide letter No. F. No. 9-2/2007-TS.I dated 22nd July, 2008.Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guide Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

Que:-o)What is the method for payment of PG Scholarship?
PG scholarship is released through PFMS on Aadhar Bridge Payment System (ABPS).
The requirements of bank details etc. are discarded with as details of Aadhar suffice
the requirement for release of scholarship on ABPS through PFMS.Please select any of the below sub-category:

About PG Scholarship
Guide Lines
Financial
PG General
Main Category

what is Public Grievances?

Refer All India Council for Technical Education (Redressal of Grievance of Students)
Regulations, 2019 which is notified in Gazette of India on 19.11.2019.  As per these Regulations
it is mandatory for Establishment of a Student Grievance Redressal Committee (SGRC)
by all Institution and appointment of OMBUDSPERSON by all the affiliating Universities
for the purpose of redressal of grievances of the students. All aggrieved students may approach
the SGRC of the institution, in the first instance; and if they are not satisfied with the decision of the committee,
they may send their appeals to the respective OMBUDSPERSON of the concerned University

Public Grievances deals with all types of grievances,
complaints and malpractices including those received from Students,
Faculty and other Stakeholders.

Students in distress owing to ragging related incidents can call the National Anti ragging Helpline (Toll Free) Number (24x7)
1800 - 180 - 5522 to file his/her complaint  and also directly lodged his/her complaint  through www.antiragging.in

intents.tag: Violation of Norms and standards by AICTE approved Institute
patterns: Violation of Norms and standards by AICTE approved Institute
responses:
In this regard if any person has any specific complaint against any AICTE approved institution
regarding violation of norms and standards as prescribed in AICTE-Approval Process Handbook.
The complainant may send  duly signed hard copy of the same along with supporting documents/evidence,
if any, with complete postal address directly  to Dy Director, Public Grievance Redressal Cell of AICTE Hqrs,
Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi-110070.

intents.tag: Service related matters of faculty or staff of AICTE approved Institutions
patterns: Service related matters of faculty or staff of AICTE approved Institutions
responses:
Refer All India Council for Technical Education (Redressal of Grievance of Faculty/Staff Member)
Regulations 2021 which is notified in the Gazette of India on 25.03.2021.
  As per these Regulations, it is mandatory for all technical institution to address the grievance of faculty/staff
members including service matters at the institution level itself. A Grievance Redressal Committee (GRC) for faculty/staff
members shall be constituted by each institution to look into the grievance of the faculty/staff members.
In case faculty/staff is not satisfied with the decision of Grievance Redressal Committee, they may appeal to the concerned affiliating
University/ State DTE (in case of diploma institutions) for redressal of their grievances.

online courses for SWAYAM AICTE is functioning as 9th National Coordinator (NC) for

courses as per Terms of Reference contained in SWAYAM MOOC Guidelines 2017.

Que:-Even after meeting all the criteria I am not able to generate my certificate?
Participants have to register on ATAL portal and their participation is to
be approved by the coordinator before the commencement of the FDP/CPDP. Certification has laid down criteria
wherein participants must have 80% attendance, 70% marks in assessment and mandatory Feedback on ATAL Portal.
Please select any of the below sub-category

About ATAL
Coordinator
Participants
Main Category

Que:-Someone has attended the FDP/CPDP and is not able to download the certificate/not received the certificate?
Certificate will be approved by the admin with in 2 working days in respect of participants fulfilling
the following criteria  Coordinator has uploaded Mandate, Logo and Signature  Participant approved
by the Coordinator Has minimum 80% attendance, 70% marks, uploaded by Coordinator.
Overall 90% and above shall be treated as distinction.  Filled and uploaded the feedback form.
Please select any of the below sub-category

About ATAL
Coordinator
Participants
Main Category

Que:-How to delete the entry of applied workshop by the participant?
If the status of your applied FDP/CPDP is 'Approved', then please contact the FDP/CPDP coordinator concerned to disapprove your
If the status of your applied FDP is Submitted, then you may delete your entry by pressing sign - (minus)
from your login id under applied workshop.

Que:-How many maximum FDPs/CPDPs, a participant can attend?
A participant can sign up and attend a maximum of four FDPs/CPDPs (2 Basic and 2 Advance) per academic year.

patterns: What are the Objectives of the Scheme?
responses:
The scheme was initiated to facilitate continuation of education and also interaction
between the students beyond class hours for their all-around development.
The scheme supports Government/ Government-aided engineering colleges/ University departments/ Polytechnics
 for construction of hostel in the campus.Please select any of the below sub-category
About

Eligibility
AQIS General
Main Category
The hostel has to be completed in 3 years.

Limit oRs. 3 crore are given for hostel and Rs. 25 lakh for indoor sports;
 gym equipemnts and library, in the hostel.f Funding from AICTE?

Disbursement of 50% of the amount (1st installment) in advance upon sanction of proposal then 40% of amount
(2nd installment), and 10% on submitting completion certificate by registered Civil engineer.

intents.tag: ###Will the cost of online webinar platform be included in the expenditure  for online conference

responses: No such guidelines, institutes may manage at their own.

intents.tag: ##If both coordinator & co-coordinator is transferred/ changed then how does the detail of another coordinator get updated
patterns: If both coordinator & co-coordinator is transferred/ changed then how does the detail of another coordinator get updated
responses:
Go to Request for Change of coordinator attach letter with new coordinator
name designation e mail and phone number duly signed by HoI and submit. Institute must appoint another faculty
as coordinator with qualifications and experience must be matching with
the previous one and take approval by AICTE

Following are the FAQs I can help you with:

We are a Private University, are we eligible to apply for  MODROB Scheme?

intents.tag: ###We are a Private University, are we eligible to apply for  MODROB Scheme
patterns: We are a Private University, are we eligible to apply for  MODROB Scheme
responses:
AICTE approved Technical Institutions (including Polytechnics) / University Departments can
only apply for this Scheme. If, however, the private university is approved by AICTE, then you are eligible to apply.

intents.tag: What rules are to be followed for procurement of equipment in the project sanctioned
patterns: What rules are to be followed for procurement of equipment in the project sanctioned
responses: To utilize this grant, you must follow the GoI rules under laid down in Chapter 6 PROCUREMENT OF GOODS AND SERVICES of the GFR 2017. Copy of which can be accessed from https://doe.gov.in/sites/default/files/GFR2017_0.pdf

intents.tag: ###Can the equipment purchased be used for research and consultancy
patterns: Can the equipment purchased be used for research and consultancy
responses:
Yes, AICTE encourages optimum utilization of equipment under MODROB which are primarily
provided to augment the quality of UG teaching. They can be used to offer internships,
conduct training and research work also.

intents.tag: Are the equipment to be shared with others
patterns: Are the equipment to be shared with others
responses:
Yes, It is mandatory to inform availability of equipment's for use by
others through the i-STEM poral. (www.istem.gov.in)

About SPICES
SPICES Eligibility
SPICES General

intents.tag: What is the aim of this scheme
patterns: What is the aim of this scheme
responses:
Every technical institution encourages student activities by way of student clubs which help in their overall grooming.
The idea behind this scheme is to have at least one club evolved as model club with assistance from AICTE and institution.
The chosen club must utilize the combined grant to take up activities and also raise funds for them.

Please select any of the below sub-category

About SPICES
SPICES Eligibility
SPICES General
Main Category

intents.tag: What is AICTE expecting from the institution
patterns: What is AICTE expecting from the institution
responses:
AICTE expects institution to fund its other clubs in a similar fashion and intensify their activities.
Vibrant clubs will attract attention of other institutions and inspire the latter to emulate.
Thus there will be intensification of club activities across the country.

About SWAYAM
ARPIT Scheme
Courses

SWAYAM is one of the World's largest Online Free E-Learning Platform indigenously developed by AICTE under Ministry of Education,
Government of India to achieve  three cardinal principles of Education Policy viz., Access,
Equity and Quality by covering School/ Vocational, Under-Graduate, Post Graduate, Engineering and Other Professional Courses.

MOOCs means Massive Open Online Courses.  Such MOOCs  are free online courses available on SWAYAM Platform
accessible by all  to enroll. MOOCs provide an affordable and flexible way to learn new skills for
advancement of one's  career through  deliver of quality e-learning.

intents.tag: What are the advantages of SWAYAM
responses:
SWAYAM Platform  is  One-stop web and mobile based interactive e-content for
all courses from High School to University level.
High quality learning experience using multimedia on anytime, anywhere basis
State of the art system that allows easy access, monitoring and certification.
Peer group interaction and discussion forum to clarify doubts
Hybrid model of delivery that adds to the quality of classroom teaching.

After completion of ARPIT course, an online exam will be conducted
After successful  completion of ARPIT Exam, the learner will be issued certificate of
completion of course. Successful completion of one ARPIT course with certificate 
will be equivalent to one refresher  course of UGC for Career Advancement Scheme (CAS)
as notified by the latest gazette of UGC.
